intro: Eria collina, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant typically grows as a small, herbaceous perennial with thin, wiry stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive, spurred labellum. Eria collina thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
